intro: Trigonella lunata f. flaviflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered fenugreek, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow, pea-like flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, preferring well-drained soils. It has small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. The subspecies flaviflora is distinguished by its more intensely yellow floral coloration compared to the typical form.
